result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rebecca M Schulz

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rebecca M Schulz in court.  Attorney Joshua Ryan-Polczinski in court for Rebecca M Schulz.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Samuel Berg. Called @ 2:07 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for adjourned initial appearance. Record by Atty. Ryan as to charges and penalties and enters not guilty plea. Matter set for status.
Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rebecca M Schulz in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Samuel Berg. Called @ 1:57 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for adjourned initial appearance. Defendant responds to Court's questions regarding attorney. Response by Defendant that she has not been able to get ahold of the SPD's office. Court provides information again and sets matter out a few weeks so defendant can get counsel. Court in recess.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Rebecca M Schulz in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Samuel Berg. Called @ 2:42 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for adjourned initial appearance. Court goes over charges/penalties, and right to attorney information. Defendant wishes to contact public defender. Court sets out so defendant can obtain attorney. Court in recess.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Original Warrant filed with the court.

Must Comply with PRETRIAL SERVICES. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH WALMART IN WHITEWATER. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Called at 2:30 PM. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rebecca M Schulz in court, in custody by video. Discussion as to why warrant was filed on misdemeanor theft under $100. Warrant quashed. Bond set at $10000 RoR. Court goes over Attorney options. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
